name: UPlayerMappableInputConfig
doc:
UPlayerMappableInputConfig

This represents one set of Player Mappable controller/keymappings. You can use this input config to create
the default mappings for your player to start with in your game. It provides an easy way to get only the player
mappable key actions, and it can be used to add multiple UInputMappingContext's at once to the player.

Populate this data asset with Input Mapping Contexts that have player mappable actions in them.

ConfigDisplayName: The display name that can be used
bIsDeprecated: A flag that can be used to mark this Input Config as deprecated to your player/designers.
Contexts: Mapping contexts that make up this Input Config with their associated priority.
ConfigName: The unique name of this config that can be used when saving it
Metadata: Metadata that can used to store any other related items to your key mapping such as icons, ability assets, etc.

methods.name: GetKeysBoundToAction
methods.doc: Returns all the keys mapped to a specific Input Action in this mapping config.

methods.name: GetMappingByName
methods.doc: Returns the action key mapping for the mapping that matches the given name

methods.name: GetMappingContexts
methods.doc: Return all the Input Mapping contexts that

methods.name: GetMetadata
methods.doc: Get all the player mappable keys in this config.

methods.name: GetPlayerMappableKeys
methods.doc: Get all the player mappable keys in this config.

methods.name: ResetToDefault
methods.doc: Resets this mappable config to use the keys
